wikipedia_page.main:
Willie Waugh (2 February 1910 – 1970) was a Scottish footballer, who played as a goalkeeper, primarily for Heart of Midlothian, although he played almost as many Scottish Football League matches for Third Lanark on a three-year loan, which included winning the 1930–31 Scottish Division Two title.Waugh was one of two players loaned by Hearts to their Edinburgh derby rivals Hibernian in 1936, which helped Hibs avoid relegation from 1935–36 Scottish Division One. After returning to Tynecastle Park, Waugh was first-choice goalkeeper as Hearts secured runners-up spot in the 1937–38 Scottish Division One season, their highest finish in 23 years.
He won one cap for Scotland in December 1937, playing in a 5–0 win against Czechoslovakia in a friendly.

response: Willie Waugh displaced Harkness as Hearts' regular goalkeeper in 1936–37. After spending the remainder of the season as a reserve, Harkness decided to retire at the comparatively young age of 29, to pursue a career in sports journalism. He wrote for the Sunday Post throughout the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s and was awarded an MBE in 1971.
